actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Monday, March 31, 2025,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Monday, March 31, 2025, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.J.Res. 24 (Rep. Bice):
        A joint resolution providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Energy relating to "Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Walk-In Coolers and Walk-In Freezers".

        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of measure agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 46. Record Vote Number: 161 


        -- Measure laid before Senate by motion.


 S.J.Res. 37 (Sen. Kaine):
        A joint resolution terminating the national emergency declared to impose duties on articles imported from Canada.

        -- Senate Committee on Finance discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 48. Record Vote Number: 160

PN12-11:
        Harmeet Dhillon, of California, to be an Assistant Attorney General

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 159 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, vote 4/3/2025.


 PN12-39:
        Dean Sauer, of Missouri, to be Solicitor General of the United States

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 46. Record Vote Number: 158 


        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 4/3/2025.
Under the authority of the order of today, at  8:04 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Husted in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
